intro: Condgiea ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf condgiea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has ovate, glossy leaves. Its botanical features include a woody stem and capsule-like fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Condgiea ovalifolia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
